title: Malaysia's Mahathir says faults committed by previous government will be investigated
text:
May 14, 2018 / 10:19 AM / Updated an hour ago Malaysia's Mahathir says faults committed by previous government will be investigated Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Monday he would appoint a new chief of the countryâ€™s anti-graft agency and that faults of the previous government would be investigated. Malaysia's newly elected Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad attends a news conference in Menara Yayasan Selangor, Pataling Jaya, Malaysia May 12, 2018. REUTERS/Stringer
Addressing a news conference, the 92-year-old Mahathir said
all government ministries had been instructed that no documents could be taken out or destroyed. Reporting by Joseph Sipalan, Editing by Raju Gopalakrishnan
